PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Route to weak synchronisation and its suppression in realistic plastic brain
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: To investigate the formation and destruction of weak synchronisation in a realistic neural network model whose connecting architecture is formed by a cluster of sub-networks. To understand how synchronisation develops in cortical networks according to the competition between intra and inter connections. To understand how synchronisation can trigger plasticity in neuronal networks. In addition, to understand the fundamentals behind brain plasticity, understanding whether a plastic brain can return to present abnormal synchronisation behaviour that has been suppressed by our proposed suppression method. This knowledge can provide clues about why a person that suffered surgery to treat epilepsy can develop again this illness later in life.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Study of weaks synchronisation in clustered brain networks with neuronal dynamics based on stochastic differential equation
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The aim of the proposal is to set the ground to investigate the formation and destruction of synchronisation in neural network-models when a stochastic perturbation is induced to the model to simulate noise. Noise is a relevant brain feature as it can affect the transmission of signals and neuronal functions. There are many sources of noise in the brain, such as from genetic processes, thermal noise, ionic channel fluctuations, and synaptic events. Our research will take place in the Department of Mathematical Sciences at the
University of Essex (England) and in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Ponta Grossa (Brazil).
